name: graceless
content:
graceless adjective
(NOT ATTRACTIVE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
not attractive in appearance: He described the house as ugly and graceless. Her outwardly graceless appearance camouflages her inner radiance.
More examplesFewer examplesThe central shopping streets are brash and graceless. What you have is a functional, if visually graceless, design.People will pay $1 million for a graceless, boxy house on a soulless street because it represents a social goal.

graceless adjective
(NOT POLITE)
not polite or showing respect or sympathy towards others : a graceless manner It was the most graceless acceptance speech I have ever heard. He is generally disliked, seen by his fellow players as selfish, mean, graceless and arrogant.
More examplesFewer examplesSpecter's comment was characteristically graceless.His self-belief and desire to win combine to make him both stubborn and, at times, graceless.When luck is something you inherit or buy, grumbling at the complaints of the less fortunate is graceless.
